item.title: Obstruction on the highway caused by water egress from private land, 23rd December
item.description:
Water egress from 269 Green Lanes is obstructing the footpath. Public have to walk in the road to avoid being sprayed by the egress. This has been ongoing since Sunday 21 December 2025.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brownswood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Puddle and mud collects on road at drop kerb, 23rd December
item.description:
Since Shortlands Road was re-surfaced, the drop kerb at the bottom of the driveway of 31 Shortlands Road is lower than the surrounding road and pavement. As a result, water and mud tends to collect there. Over time, this will wear away at the surface and make a larger hole. It should be higher so that water and mud runs away to the drain, as works well on the rest of the length of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Park Road a few yards from s, 23rd December
item.description:
Crystal Palace Park Road a few yards from streetlight column number 20 (diagonally opposite Sydenham Ave junction) are a couple of green footpath boxes – all boxes graffiti tagged. Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4230502,-0.0633572,3a,79.9y,230.84h,62.75t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1s7l_m3Or_WxX9Ybv5y5Q4WA!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D27.247365170023286%26panoid%3D7l_m3Or_WxX9Ybv5y5Q4WA%26yaw%3D230.8391471085107!7i16384!8i8192?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTIwOS4wIKXMDSoKLDEwMDc5MjA2N0gBUAM%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress on pavement, 23rd December
item.description:
No 57 Bethel Road wads cleared out by the council last week who arranged a skip. When the skip arrived on Saturday morning as it was piled too high the skip driver took it off and leaned it up against No 57’s wall. However this mattress has been blown down in the wind blocking the pathway. Could you please arrange as soon as possible for the mattress to be taken away as there are plenty of foxes who will rip it open and cause havoc. It’s a problem for people walking past with push chairs, or blind or partially blind etc as the pathway is blocked and they will have to walk out in the road to go past so this is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bethel Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of litter, 23rd December
item.description:
Please can the bin at the bus stop be emptied and the surrounding litter be removed as soon as possible please? Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass, 23rd December
item.description:
Every weekend the christ Church has a gathering and lots of cars park on the grass opposite side of church highlighted in pink markers, and on pavements for a lkng while now, as in photo look at the damage caused. there needs to be traffic enforcement officers there on Sundays as parked on pavements marked with double yellows, and bollards put in place. this is every sunday. the church management are responsible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cross Street, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti in Sutton Walk along the pedestrian access from Waterloo Station to the South Bank.n, 23rd December
item.description:
Now that the pedestrian route from the South Bank ie. Belvedere Road towards Waterloo Station has been improved, (in spite of the undersized litter bins), are you planning to replace the random graffiti along Sutton Walk with a permanent artistic mural? This would present both a positive, less threatening impression to visitors to Central London and a meaningful connection to the South Bank centre. Graffiti scribblers usually respect decent art. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Mepham Street, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
